name: Republicano Government
description: The Republican party is less of an ideological grouping and more of an odd alliance of the so-called New Oligarchy in Brazil. Farmers, industrialists, officers and intellectuals hoping to steer the nation slowly, but surely, towards the future.

name: Moral & Civica
description: By ensuring that children across the country receive a proper Christian education, with religious classes and festivities, we can both please sectors of our society and ensure a better future for our future generations.

name: Crush Interstate Banditry
description: Bandits, terrorists and all kinds of miscreants have for too long taken advantage of the lack of proper federal law enforcement to evade justice. Close cooperation between often clashing oligarchs will be needed to end their rampage.

name: Church Backing
description: The church and the Republic have been traditionally lukewarm in their relationship, but that only weakened Brazil and left it vulnerable to dangerous ideas. Mending relations with Rome is in order.

name: Formalize State Power Boundaries
description: States within our union still have a significant amount of attrition between them. Many issues face legal limbos and impasses, and such disputes divert the government's attention from other matters. Thus, changing this is needed, albeit such an endeavour will be significantly hard.

name: Grand Public Works
description: In Brazil, you rule by opening roads. And other pieces of infrastructure, things that the people can see and touch; it's a natural by product of the years of empty promises faced by the people. If we want to hope for re-election, we need a grandio.

name: Centres of Higher Learning
description: A great deal of funding is being diverted to increase the number of people in our country who complete college education. We hope to turn what was once a privilege into something that is accessible by all.

name: Grand National Accord
description: For many years now, Republican leadership has juggled local interests, powerful industrial moguls and military officers to keep stability and progress in Brazil. We have to keep this going.

name: Industrialist Measures
description: Let us hear what our captains of industry suggest to deal with the current economic situation; after all, who would be more qualified?

name: Automotive Subsidies
description: Our friends in the automotive industry have long requested for tax breaks in their important and vital business, and we will oblige, for we desire nothing but the best for the nation.

name: PSI
description: Our main idea towards what we see our future is to ensure our true independence from foreign powers. This is to be achieved via a method known as Import Substitution: we will gradually replace all imports with goods manufactured by Brazilians for Brazilians. An expensive and expansive endeavour, but one that will truly develop Brazil.

name: Protect Our Industry
description: In order for our programs to succeed, we must protect our goods from disloyal foreign competition, ensuring our capacity to industrialise as planned.

name: Regulate Imports
description: A vital step in our PSI program is to protect Brazilian goods from competition of larger economies. In addition to tariffs, we will limit the amount of certain products that can be imported, to ensure that the people buy Brazilian goods.

name: Seek German Capital
description: The greatest superpower of the age, Germany, has many private individuals who know a good deal when they see one. Investing in our industry in its early stages will give the few adventurous folks who do it huge returns in the long run.

name: Seek British Capital
description: While not exactly the greatest of nations, Canada is filled of great men, with great fortunes, itching for a chance to get richer. Investing in our industry in its early stages will give the few adventurous folks who do it huge returns in the long run.

name: The Locomotive
description: São Paulo's captains of industry have always been at the forefront of the nation, and in the modern day it is no different! The grand locomotive of our industry will keep moving forward and pulling thousands out of a life of rural poverty.

name: O Petroleo é Nosso
description: Popular support for complete state control of oil has always been there, but it has in recent years skyrocketed to a massive public issue, especially due to the efforts of children's book author turned rabble rouser Monteiro Lobato. By abiding to what is now the demands of the public, we also ensure control over this vital asset of war.

name: Esquerda Democrática Government
description: The Democratic Left alliance is eclectic and decentralized, united only by the wishes for a better and fairer Brazil. Our government will be a balancing act, but one that must succeed if our homeland is to thrive.

name: Secure Workers' Rights
description: For too long workers have lived at the mercy of their employers, with gruelling work shifts and lack of basic rights such as paid vacations. In order to change this, we must create new laws and override existing ones, and save Brazil's people from greedy interlopers.

name: Increase Public Salaries
description: Many Brazilians who work for the states have languished under below inflation raises for a long time; changing this matter would mean that they would have more money to spend, but also would give us some much-needed political support.

name: Railway Projects
description: We must improve the sorry state of our infrastructure directly, and there is no time to wait for investors or private help; acting swiftly and decisively towards a more planned infrastructure growth is needed

name: The Left Front
description: Our alliance's vast differences in vision for Brazil have created many discussions, and often we cannot act in unison in parliament. If we seek to change that, we must take an effort to create a proper ED charter for our Left Front.

name: Heavy Handed Development
description: Sometimes, the invisible hand needs a light nudge in the right direction. This isn't one of those times, for the state must take greater reign over the economy!

name: Plano de Metas
description: We will set a grand strategic goal of industrialisation and economic build up; this so called Goals Plan will be our north that will guide all acts of economic policy.

name: Dobrando as Metas
description: We don't have a set goal for industrialisation. When we reach our goal, we will simply double our goal, and keep moving Brazil forward.

name: Conquest of the West
description: Our infrastructure, much like our populace, is heavily concentrated in the coastline of the nation, leaving inland towns without proper connection to the world at large. Changing this would help bring development to these areas.

name: Taming the Sertão
description: The vast dry lands, the weary villagers, the small towns, the scorching sun. A reminder of another time, when Brazil was almost antonymous with progress. Time will wash away these images, after the trains start their routes.

name: Inflation Struggle
description: As predicted, our expansionist monetary policy has created an excess of currency on the market. In order to fix this situation before it escalates further, we will have to take some cautionary measures, and quickly so.

name: Liberal Government
description: While to some a symbol of the Old Republic, the Liberals have little in common to the old marshals who ruled that. Their vision of a future based on republican and humanist ideas may not be shared by many Brazilians, but they will try to achieve it nonetheless.

name: Civil Liberties
description: We must work towards protecting people's rights, for even their most basic ones were under threat from violent groups in recent years. Quasi military groups seek to undermine our basic rights, and we will not allow them to do so.

name: Safeguard Press Freedoms
description: The right to voice your own opinions is the most basic one in a republic, and especially so when it comes to the press. From the respected newspaper to the shameless tabloid, we will pass no judgement and allow Brazilians to decide truth from forgery.

name: State Taxation Reforms
description: Too many taxes are kept at a federal level, a clear betrayal of the federal arrangement dating years now. We will ensure that each federal unity has enough income to properly sustain itself.

name: Positivism
description: Positivism was the value on which the Brazilian Republic was founded, but that was forgotten as that Old Republic became mired by greed and military ambition. We will renew our commitment to a free and sovereign Brazil that is always moving forward.

name: Soften Regulations
description: Overly strict regulations over banks and other institutions, coupled with excessive taxation, are causing issues in these times of uncertainty. We must ensure our economy works smoothly.

name: Local Tax Breaks
description: Several items of Brazilians' day to day lives have had their prices altered by the recent economic upheaval. By enacting tax breaks on certain day to day items, we will improve the situation of the country, first locally, and then nationally.

name: Financial Institutions
description: Our government lacks many hallmarks of a proper modern economy, from macro-economic planning to basic currency control. If we are to improve our capacity to intervene when needed, we must ensure our tools to do so are properly sharpened.

name: Mining Grants
description: Brazil's vast mineral wealth is ours for the taking. All we need to do is to ensure our prospectors can properly tap into this immense wealth.

name: Flexibilise Unions
description: We will ensure that unions are not only not mandatory, but also work towards ensuring they have a smaller participation in political matters, and adding restrictions to striking on vital services.

name: Liberal Democráta Government
description: The so-called Liberals in our nation have no idea what liberalism truly means; their simple opposing of the Republicans is their entire program. It's high time for Brazil to truly abide by the principles of a free republic.

name: Flexibilise Work Laws
description: The fixed laws set by previous administrations are too strict and encourage informal employment. We should modernize and flexibilise contracts with a modern, forward looking mindset.

name: Coffee Tax Breaks
description: Our farmers and their noble efforts are what push Brazil's economy forwards. There is no time to waste on rescuing them from the last disastrous few years, for they are vital to our nation's future.

name: Strict Protection of Liberties
description: We will not allow anti republican sentiment to rise again, but all non-treasonous thought can and should be heard, and all kinds of press should be respected.

name: Curb Developmentalism
description: The concept that state intervention in the economy is the key to development is a folly born of highly unusual times of global instability. The only way a nation can truly become rich is by allowing free enterprises to flourish in a proper fashion.

name: Garner Private Capital
description: By establishing joint ventures with our private sector, we can improve our nation's recovering economic situation

name: Bastion of Liberty
description: Liberty and justice for all is the ultimate goal of all republics. As the light of freedom dims across the brutal and irrational world we live in, some believe that tyranny is necessary to maintain order. But we, citizens of a republic already torn asunder by a war for liberty, know that peace is its own reward.

name: State Level Fiscal Responsibility
description: The state governments have for too long spent far more than they gain, mostly in flashy displays of power by elites in form of pointless roadworks. To improve this situation, proper legal safeguards must be put in place.

name: Lower Salary Increase Rates
description: Much of the total expenses of the state come from government workers, who do little work and are paid very generously for it; most of the stations are in fact gifted by politicians to their friends and favoured ones. By trimming the number of public workers and drastically cutting the rate of their salary increases, we will greatly improve our income.

name: Fiscal Reforms
description: Fiscal reform at a federal level is a daunting task; but there are many areas of spending that can be cut outright, such funding for leftist artists other luxuries the government paid to members of the so-called political elites.

name: Gold Reserves
description: In such dangerous times that we live in, the market desperately craves for safety, for something whose price is not as fluctuating as battle lines in a war. Gold is the answer, and increasing our reserves will increase our trustworthiness, both in our government and in our currency.
